channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange strikes plea deal with the U.S.
item.description: Under the deal, Assange faces a sentence of 62 months, equivalent to the time he has already served in Britain. He is expected to be released and to return to Australia following the court proceeding.
item.content:encoded:
Under the deal, Assange faces a sentence of 62 months, equivalent to the time he has already served in Britain. He is expected to be released and to return to Australia following the court proceeding.


(Image credit: Peter Nicholls)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: Supreme Court to weigh in on laws banning treatments for trans minors
item.description: The justices have agreed to hear only the claim that Tennessee’s law denies trans minors the equal protection of the law.
item.content:encoded:
The justices have agreed to hear only the claim that Tennessee’s law denies trans minors the equal protection of the law.

(Image credit: Liam James Doyle)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: Immigrant communities in Maine react to Biden's executive actions
item.description: President Biden’s executive moves to severely limit asylum for those entering the U.S. without authorization are being met in immigrant communities with a mix of confusion, angst and disappointment.
item.content:encoded: President Biden’s executive moves to severely limit asylum for those entering the U.S. without authorization are being met in immigrant communities with a mix of confusion, angst and disappointment.
item.dc:creator: Ari Snider

item.title: A look back at the start of the Zionist movement and its founder
item.description: NPR's history podcast, Throughline, goes back to the late 19th century to meet the people who organized the modern Zionist movement.
item.content:encoded: NPR's history podcast, Throughline, goes back to the late 19th century to meet the people who organized the modern Zionist movement.
item.dc:creator: Rund Abdelfatah

item.title: Scientists look at the connection between gut health and resilience to stress
item.description: Scientists are trying to decode how the trillions of microorganisms in our gut talk with the brain and shape our resilience to stress. A new study offers some initial clues.
item.content:encoded: Scientists are trying to decode how the trillions of microorganisms in our gut talk with the brain and shape our resilience to stress. A new study offers some initial clues.
item.dc:creator: Will Stone

item.title: Where things stand since 'Roe v. Wade' was overturned two years ago
item.description: On the second anniversary of the decision that overturned Roe v. Wade turns two, there are some surprises. The number of abortions is up, and medication abortions are more than 60% of abortions.
item.content:encoded: On the second anniversary of the decision that overturned Roe v. Wade turns two, there are some surprises. The number of abortions is up, and medication abortions are more than 60% of abortions.
item.dc:creator: Selena Simmons-Duffin

item.title: How one Brazilian city is tackling the surge of dengue cases
item.description: In Brazil, year-round epidemics of what is known as “breakbone fever” are becoming the norm, weighing heavily on healthcare systems and pushing leaders to look for new solutions to combat the disease.
item.content:encoded: In Brazil, year-round epidemics of what is known as “breakbone fever” are becoming the norm, weighing heavily on healthcare systems and pushing leaders to look for new solutions to combat the disease.

item.title: Colorado's Lauren Boebert campaign will decide if she remains a congresswoman
item.description: Republican Congresswoman Lauren Boebert is running again in a different part of Colorado. With the primary on Tuesday, here's a look at the campaign that will determine whether she keeps her title.
item.content:encoded: Republican Congresswoman Lauren Boebert is running again in a different part of Colorado. With the primary on Tuesday, here's a look at the campaign that will determine whether she keeps her title.
item.dc:creator: Caitlyn Kim

item.title: The deciding game of the NHL Stanley Cup Final should be a thrilling end
item.description: The seventh and deciding game of the NHL Stanley Cup Final should be a thrilling end to a great series. The Florida Panthers won the first three games and then the Edmonton Oilers won the next three.
item.content:encoded: The seventh and deciding game of the NHL Stanley Cup Final should be a thrilling end to a great series. The Florida Panthers won the first three games and then the Edmonton Oilers won the next three.
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: Georgia voters weigh in ahead of the Biden-Trump debate
item.description: Just 11,779 votes separated Biden and Trump when they last shared a ballot in Georgia. They'll share a debate stage this week in Atlanta, as they fight for the voters who could swing the election.
item.content:encoded: Just 11,779 votes separated Biden and Trump when they last shared a ballot in Georgia. They'll share a debate stage this week in Atlanta, as they fight for the voters who could swing the election.
item.dc:creator: Sam Gringlas
